name: menchi katsu kare/ hamburger croquette w Japanese curry sauce
ingredientLines: 1/2 of a medium-size apple or pear (65 grams) or a mixture of both, diced
2 cups (500 ml/500 grams) of chicken or beef stock
1/4 cup (65 ml/65 grams) of whole milk
3.5 oz (100 grams) of Japanese curry cubes (such as this one)
0.5 oz (15 grams) of bittersweet chocolate, or 2 tsp of coco powder
0.5 oz (15 grams) of bittersweet chocolate, or 2 tsp of coco powder
0.5 oz (15 grams) of bittersweet chocolate, or 2 tsp of coco powder
17.6 oz (500 grams) of ground beef, or a mixture of ground beef and pork
1/2 tsp of freshly ground black pepper
2 cups (112 grams) of Japanese panko breadcrumbs (or see instruction on how to make your own)
4 tbsp of peanut oil ONLY if pre-baking
1/4 tsp of freshly ground black pepper
1/2 cup (65 grams) of all-purpose flour, seasoned with a bit of salt’n pepper
2 large eggs, beaten and seasoned with a bit of salt’n pepper
1 tbsp of sesame paste (preferably Japanese-type that’s lightly toasted, but tahini could probably work too)
